author: BrickRandom
title: Not as good looking as the picture
review:
I picked up this polybag at a local drugstore for € 2,99. I have never watched NinjaGo, but the car looked ok in the picture and at this price it got me some 70 pieces (plus spares) for around 4 cents per piece.

The build is (as expected for such a small set) quite simple. The front, sides and back use some SNOT as you often see in little cars builds. Building the car is a matter of minutes.

There are a few parts which are a welcome addition to my (currently very small) LEGO collection, such as the swords, nozzles, hinges, fancy wheels and rounded plates.

The main thing that strikes me about this car, though, is that once built, it is quite ugly. As said, I have never seen any NinjaGo, so I don't know what this is supposed to represent so it might be a good rendition of some vehicle in the series. But just as a car to build and look at, I don't like it. The picture on the polybag probably the only ok angle, so the real thing doesn't quite meet my expectation. Some other small polybag builds are kept around my desk, but this one is going straight into the 'to be taken apart and sorted later' box.

So, overall: some nice parts at a low price, but not a pretty thing to look at.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Cars Make Excellent Polybags.
review:
Set #30536 Combo Charger: Welcome to Ninjago Legacy’s first 2020 Polybag. A buildable two-in-one model featuring the Combo Charger, which… source material wise I’m drawing a blank on. I forget which season it was used in. It’s one of Kai’s vehicles though. This polybag’s pros and cons are next, then final thoughts.

Pros:

  • Excellent vehicle build.
  • Two-In-One model can be rebuilt from car into plane.
  • Excellent parts-per-piece ratio.

Cons:

  • Not available at most retailers yet.
  • Instructions for second model only available online.

Overall opinion

I’m pretty impressed with the models in this set. I like the car, while the plane mode is rather interesting too. It’s just a shame LEGO did not make this a transforming model, but at this scale I can understand why they’d only have the option for a 2-in-1 build. I’d recommend picking this up if you can find it in stores. It’s a pretty nice model, the colours are great and the gold katana are always welcome in any set. Recommended.
